unnormalised: New Delhi, Oct 26, 2023 – The sporting landscape is ever-evolving, but one constant is the specter of injuries. Here’s a rundown of the latest injury updates affecting Indian athletes across various disciplines.
normalised: New Delhi, October twenty six, two thousand and twenty three – The sporting landscape is ever-evolving, but one constant is the specter of injuries. Here is a rundown of the latest injury updates affecting Indian athletes across various disciplines.

unnormalised: In cricket, concerns surround Rohit Sharma, who sustained a minor hamstring strain during the recent ODI against Australia in Chennai. While initial reports suggest it's not serious, the medical team at the National Cricket Academy (NCA) in Bengaluru is closely monitoring his progress. A final call on his participation in the upcoming T20 series will be made after further assessment on Oct 28th. Jasprit Bumrah, recovering from a back injury since late August, is undergoing rigorous rehabilitation at the NCA and is targeting a return to competitive cricket by the end of November. Sources within the BCCI indicate that his workload is being carefully managed to prevent a recurrence.

unnormalised: Moving to badminton, PV Sindhu’s recovery from a knee injury suffered at the Commonwealth Games is progressing well. Her physio, based in Hyderabad, reports that Sindhu is gradually increasing her on-court training hours. While a confirmed return date is yet to be announced, she is aiming to participate in the All England Open in March 2024. Kidambi Srikanth, battling persistent ankle issues, has consulted with specialists at the All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) in Delhi. Doctors recommended a customized training regime focusing on strengthening exercises.

unnormalised: Track and field athlete Hima Das is recovering from a hamstring injury. Sources state she is undergoing rehab and training at NIS Patiala and is expected to be back by the end of November. Her coach has emphasized a cautious approach, drawing parallels to the slow and steady strategy portrayed in the Bollywood film "Bhaag Milkha Bhaag," highlighting the importance of patience and perseverance in overcoming setbacks. A 10 km run scheduled for early November will be a key test of her readiness.

unnormalised: Finally, in kabaddi, Pro Kabaddi League (PKL) star Pardeep Narwal suffered a shoulder dislocation during a recent training camp. The injury, sustained during a raiding drill, required immediate medical attention. While the extent of the injury is still being evaluated, team officials fear he might miss a significant portion of the upcoming PKL season. Recovery will depend on the severity of the ligament damage. Doctors are prescribing rest, physiotherapy and may recommend surgery based on further diagnostic imaging.
